Contents list compiled by Mary Elizabeth LennonFales Library and Special CollectionsFales Library and Special CollectionsElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South3rd FloorNew York, NY 10012Phone: (212) 998-2596fales.library@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-07-31T21:07:58Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Fales Library and Special Collections
Frank Hentschker Collection of Off and Off-Off Broadway Ephemera
Hentschker, Frank
Hentschker, Frank
MSS 416
1 Linear Feet in 1 record carton.
2004-2009 Dr. Frank Hentschker is a faculty member in the Theatre program at The Graduate Center, City University of New York, and serves as the Executive Director and Director of Programs at the Martin E. Segal Theatre Center. The collection contains Off and Off-Off Broadway ephemera Hentschker collected, including fliers, invitations, and programs. Materials date from 2004 to 2009. Materials are in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Frank Hentschker in 2006. The accession number associated with this gift is 2014.416.
Arrangement
Materials are arranged alphabetically by name of venue.
Biographical Note
Dr. Frank Hentschker holds a Ph.D. in Theatre from the Theatre Institute in Giessen, Germany and joined the Faculty of the Ph.D. Program in Theatre at The Graduate Center, City University of New York, in 2009. Frank Hentschker is the Executive Director and Director of Programs at the Martin E. Segal Theatre Center at the CUNY Graduate Center. Through his work at the Segal Theatre Center, Hentschker founded the annual festival Prelude: At the Forefront of Contemporary NYC Theatre andPEN: World Voices Playwrights Series. Before working at CUNY, Hentschker worked as a producer, consultant, and actor, in the U.S. and Europe.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Frank Hentschker Collection of Off and Off-Off Broadway Ephemera; MSS 416; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Processing Information
Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.
Scope and Contents
The collection contains Off and Off-Off Broadway ephemera collected by Frank Hentschker. Materials include fliers, invitations, and programs. The materials date from 2004 to 2009.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Frank Hentschker was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
